IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE LOCAL COMMUNITY-BASED HEALTH & WELLNESS SERVICES FOCUSED ON A SAFE & HIGH QUALITY HEALTHCARE EXPERIENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY CARE WITH COMPETENCE, EXCELLENCE AND COMPASSION.
IRS990.Desc: HOSPITAL PATIENT CARE OPERATIONS (EXCLUDING ER) - IN FISCAL YEAR 4/30/23, ROCHELLE HOSPITAL HAD 1,218 INPATIENT DAYS AND PERFORMED 39,204 OUTPATIENT REGISTRATIONS. THE HOSPITAL IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF HEALTHCARE FOR EVERYONE REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY. THE HOSPITAL SUBSIDIZES THE COST OF TREATING PATIENTS WHO ARE UNINSURED OR UNABLE TO PAY OR REQUIRE GOVERNMENT ASSISTANCE WHERE REIMBURSEMENT IS LIMITED. ROCHELLE HOSPITAL IS ALSO COMMITTED TO EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY REGARDING HEALTHCARE ISSUES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ROCHELLE HOSPITAL PROVIDES 24-HOUR EMERGENCY SERVICES IN THE EMERGENCY ROOM, WHICH IS STAFFED BY FULL-TIME ATTENDING PHYSICIANS. PATIENTS ARE SEEN REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY. THE EMERGENCY ROOM HAD 8,663 VISITS IN FISCAL YEAR 4/30/23.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HEALTHWORKS FITNESS PROMOTES THE BELIEF THAT A HEALTHIER LIFESTYLE THROUGH EXERCISES AND EDUCATION REALLY DOES WORK! WE DO THIS NOT ONLY BY WORKING WITH YOU AFTER AN ILLNESS OR SURGERY, BUT BY TRAINING YOU IN PREVENTION AS WELL. THAT'S WHY HEALTHWORKS WAS CREATED. IT'S OUR GOAL TO HELP SATISFY THE HEALTH AND FITNESS NEEDS TO THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING FITNESS EQUIPMENT, TRAINING AND SPECIAL INDIVIDUALIZED EXERCISE PRESCRIPTIONS.HEALTHWORKS FITNESS ALSO HOUSES CARDIOPULMONARY REHABILITATION. THIS AREA INCLUDES A CONSULTATION ROOM, REHAB CHECK-IN AREA WHERE PAITENTS CAN MEET WITH CARDIOPULMONARY STAFF TO GET THEIR VITAL READINGS AND DISCUSS REHABILITIATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL IS A MEMBER OF THE ILLINOIS HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION AND THE AMERICAN HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION, BOTH OF WHICH CONDUCT LOBBYING ON BEHALF OF THEIR MEMBERS. THE AMOUNT REPORTED IS THE PORTION OF MEMBERSHIP DUES SPENT ON LOBBYING. NO OTHER LOBBYING ACTIVITIES WERE CONDUCTED.

SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: PART V, SECTION B, LINE 5: THE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT WAS CONDUCTED BY GATHERING DATA THROUGH FOCUS GROUPS, SECONDARY DATA ANALYSIS AND KEY STAKEHOLDER INTERVIEWS. FOUR FOCUS GROUPS WERE SCHEDULED IN MARCH 2022. FOUR FOCUS GROUPS WERE SCHEDULED TO OCCUR OVER THE COURSE OF TWO WEEKS IN MARCH 2022 TO OBTAIN INFORMATION FROM COMMUNITY RESIDENTS. RCH PROVIDED NAMES AND CONTACT INFORMATION FOR 96 POTENTIAL ATTENDEES. RHI REACHED OUT TO ALL 96 TO INVITE THEM TO PARTICIPATE. ATTENDEES COULD CHOOSE THE FOCUS GROUP THEY PREFERRED TO ATTEND BASED ON THEIR AVAILABILITY. EACH FOCUS GROUP INCLUDED A MIX OF ATTENDEES REPRESENTING THEIR COMMUNITY. ATTENDEES INCLUDED SENIORS, REPRESENTATIVES FROM BUSINESSES, HEALTH CARE CONSUMERS, AND SOCIAL SERVICES. 15 PEOPLE PARTICIPATED IN TOTAL. SECONDARY DATA ANALYSIS WAS CONDUCTED TO COMPARE OGLE COUNTY WITH HENRY AND LASALLE COUNTIES, THE STATE OF ILLINOIS AND THE NATION ON POPULATION CHANGES AND DEMOGRAPHICS, SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC FACTORS, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH RISK FACTORS AND HEALTH OUTCOMES. FIFTEEN RESIDENTS WERE IDENTIFIED BY THE HOSPITAL TO POTENTIALLY PARTICIPATE IN KEY STAKEHOLDER INTERVIEWS IN MARCH 2022. THE KEY STAKEHOLDERS WERE IDENTIFIED BASED ON THE VARIOUS CONSUMER GROUPS OF LOCAL HEALTH SERVICES INCLUDING SENIOR CITIZENS, YOUNG PARENTS, HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS. INVITATIONS WERE EMAILED WITH THE KEY STAKEHOLDER QUESTIONS ATTACHED OR A PHONE CALL WAS MADE TO INVITE THEM. NINE PEOPLE AGREED TO PARTICIPATE. IN TOTAL, FOUR MEN AND FIVE WOMEN PARTICIPATED. THREE PEOPLE CHOSE TO SEND EMAIL RESPONSES TO THE INTERVIEW QUESTIONS. SIX VIRTUAL MEETING SESSIONS WERE APPROXIMATELY 20 MINUTES IN LENGTH AND INCLUDED A REVIEW OF THE SECONDARY DATA AT THE BEGINNING. EACH KEY STAKEHOLDER WAS ASKED THE SAME QUESTIONS. RESULTS WERE PRESENTED IN A TWO PART PROCESS: 1) WEBINAR TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE TEAM HIGHLIGHTING NATIONAL CHANGES IN THE HEALTH CARE SYSTEM AND FINDINGS FROM THE FOCUS GROUPS, KEY STAKEHOLDER INTERVIEWS AND SECONDARY DATA ANALYSIS AND 2) A DISCUSSION WITH A BROAD CROSS SECTION OF THE COMMUNITY TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY HEALTH PRIORITIES AND TAKE INVENTORY OF LOCAL RESOURCES AND COMMUNITY HEALTH INITIATIVES. INDIVIDUALS WHO PARTICIPATED INCLUDED: HOSPITAL CEO, CFO, CNO, CAO, COO, EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT MANAGER, OUTPATIENT SERVICES MANAGER, MARKETING INTERN, FOUNDATION AND COMMUNITY EVENTS MANAGER, FAMILY PRACTICE PHYSICIAN, OGLE COUNTY HEALTH DEPT, ROCHELLE FIRE CHIEF AND SINNISSIPPI BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES COUNSELORS.

PART V, SECTION B, LINE 11: IN MARCH 2022, ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ADOPTED ITS MOST RECENT COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT. AT THAT TIME, TWO OF THE PRIMARY NEEDS IDENTIFIED WERE:(1) IMPROVE ACCESS TO BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES(2) ADDRESS BARRIERS TO ACCESSING CAREIN ADDRESSING THE PRIMARY NEEDS IDENTIFIED IN ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL'S MOST RECENT COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR, THE HOSPITAL TOOK THE FOLLOWING ACTIONS:(1) ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL MET WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS SUCH AS POLICE, FIRE, NURSING HOME, OUTSIDE COUNSELING SERVICES AND CLERGY TO DETERMINE WHAT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES ARE NEEDED IN THE COMMUNITY AND RESOURCES ALREADY AVAILABLE.(2) ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL BEGAN WORKING ON A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH MODEL TO FIT OUR ORGANIZATION. WE HAVE DETERMINED THE MODEL WE WOULD LIKE TO USE AND THE LOCATION WE WOULD LIKE TO OFFER SERVICES. OUR PLAN IS TO HIRE A COUNSELOR AND CONTRACT FOR A PSYCHIATRIST THROUGH A TELE-HEALTH SERVICE. WE HAVE BEGUN MEETING WITH COMPANIES THAT PROVIDE THE PSYCHIATRY SERVICES TO SEE WHICH ONE WILL WORK BEST FOR RCH.(3) RCH OFFERED A DE-ESCALATION COURSE TO STAFF TO HELP THEM BECOME BETTER EQUIPPED TO DEAL WITH POTENTIALLY UNSAFE SITUATIONS.(4) RCH JOINED THE ICAHN ACCOUNTABLE CARE ORGANIZATION AND WE ARE RECEIVING GUIDANCE RELATED TO CREATING A CARE COORDINATION PROGRAM FOR OUR PATIENTS. RCH HIRED ONE CARE COORDINATOR FOR THE CLINIC PATIENTS AND IS MAKING PLANS TO HAVE A CARE COORDINATOR FOR HOSPITAL BASED PATIENTS. (5) ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL OPENED A SATELLITE CLINIC IN DEKALB TO OFFER ORTHOPEDIC SERVICES AND OTHER POSSIBLE SERVICES. (6) ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ENROLLED ADDITIONAL BILINGUAL EMPLOYEES IN MEDICAL INTERPRETATION TRAINING COURSES TO BETTER ENGAGE THE HISPANIC COMMUNITY. MARKETING AND SIGNAGE IS CONTINUING TO BE DEVELOPED AND DISTRIBUTED IN BOTH ENGLISH AND SPANISH.(7) RCH MET WITH THE AREA HIGH SCHOOLS ON CAREER OPTIONS IN HEALTH CARE. WE HAVE HAD SEVERAL AREA STUDENTS TOUR AND/OR JOB SHADOW.(8) RCH MET WITH THE DIRECTOR OF TRANSPORTATION AND HOPING TO BRING MASS TRANSIT ROUTES TO ROCHELLE. WE ALSO WORK WITH THE LEE AND OGLE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM TO ENSURE RIDES ARE AVAILABLE FOR PATIENTS.

PART V, LINE 16B, FAP APPLICATION WEBSITE:
PART V, LINE 16C, FAP PLAIN LANGUAGE SUMMARY WEBSITE:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION USED THE FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES (FPG) ALONG WITH OTHER FACTORS TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR FREE OR DISCOUNTED CARE. PER THE ORGANIZATION'S CHARITY CARE POLICY, THESE FACTORS INCLUDE: * FAMILY INCOME RELATIVE TO FAMILY SIZE AND OTHER RELATED FACTORS SUCH AS CURRENT FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS* EMPLOYMENT STATUS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, FUTURE EARNING CAPACITY WITH CONSIDERATION OF THE LIKELIHOOD OF A FINANCIAL CAPACITY SUFFICIENT TO MEET THE PATIENT'S FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IN AN ACCEPTABLE PERIOD OF TIME* FUTURE AND CURRENT ABILITY TO PAY* MEDICAL EXPENSES AS A PERCENTAGE OF A PATIENT'S ANNUAL GROSS INCOME, THE AMOUNT OF TOTAL MEDICAL BILLS OUTSTANDING, AND THE FREQUENCY OF PAYMENTS TO BE MADE IN RELATION TO THE FACTORS ABOVE* OTHER FACTORS DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE ORGANIZATION
THE RESPECTIVE IRS WORKSHEETS, AS PROVIDED IN THE INSTRUCTIONS FOR SCHEDULE H, WERE USED TO CALCULATE THE COSTS OF ITEMS WITHIN SCHEDULE H, PART I, LINE 7.
SUBSIDIZED HEALTH SERVICES INCLUDE THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT AND PHYSICIAN CLINICS, INCLUDING THE FAMILY HEALTHCARE CLINIC AND OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH CLINIC.

THE CARRYING AMOUNT OF ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE IS REDUCED BY VALUATION ALLOWANCES THAT REFLECT MANAGEMENT'S BEST ESTIMATE OF AMOUNTS THAT WILL NOT BE COLLECTED. MANAGEMENT USES A SYSTEM FOR ESTIMATING THIRD PARTY CONTRACTUAL ALLOWANCES AND LOSSES FOR UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS, WHEREBY CERTAIN PERCENTAGES OF PATIENT REVENUE FOR EACH OF THESE ALLOWANCES IS RECORDED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AS AN OFFSET TO REVENUE AND RECEIVABLES. THE PERCENTAGES USED BY MANAGEMENT ARE BASED OFF OF HISTORICAL TRENDS WITH FINAL ADJUSTMENTS MADE WHEN COST REPORTS ARE FILED. PERIODICALLY MANAGEMENT REVIEWS OUTSTANDING ACCOUNTS FOR CREDITWORTHINESS. IF THERE IS A DETERIORATION OF A MAJOR CUSTOMER'S OR CLASS OF CUSTOMER'S CREDIT WORTHINESS OR ACTUAL DEFAULTS ARE HIGHER THAN HISTORICAL EXPERIENCE, MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATES OF THE RECOVERABILITY OF AMOUNTS DUE THE HOSPITAL COULD BE ADVERSELY AFFECTED.

NO COMMUNITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES ARE REPORTED IN PART II. HOWEVER, ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL IS THE COMMUNITY'S PREDOMINANT LINK TO HEALTH CARE. LISTED BELOW ARE PROGRAMS THAT BENEFITED THE COMMUNITY.PROGRAMS IMPLEMENTED INCLUDE: -PATIENT EDUCATION PROGRAMS IN THE AREAS OF CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE, CARDIAC AND PULMONARY REHABILITATION.-STROKE CARE PROGRAM USING TELEMEDICINE TO ASSURE THE MOST EFFECTIVE AND IMMEDIATE CARE TO EMERGENCY PATIENTS PRESENTING WITH SYMPTOMS OF STROKE.-DIABETES EDUCATION PROGRAM TO REACH OUT TO THE COMMUNITY. -A PART TIME STAFF POSITION TO FOCUS ON COMMUNITY HEALTH EDUCATION TO INCLUDE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND WELLNESS FAIRS.HOSPITAL EMPLOYEES ARE INVOLVED WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS BY OFFERING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ABOUT SUICIDE PREVENTION, DRUG AND ALCOHOL ABUSE, PARENTING AND CHILDHOOD, SAFE CHILD CARE, FIRST AID AND CPR TRAINING. THE HOSPITAL PROVIDES SPORTS PHYSICALS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS TO LEARN ABOUT CAREERS IN HEALTH CARE. THE AUXILIARY GIVES HOSPITAL TOURS TO GRADE SCHOOL STUDENTS.HOSPITAL EMPLOYEES AND VOLUNTEERS ARE INVOLVED WITH LOCAL SERVICE CLUBS SERVING ON THE BOARD OR ADVISORY COMMITTEES FOR THE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE, PLANNING AND ZONING COMMISSION, FIRE AND POLICE COMMISSION, UNITED WAY, KISHWAUKEE COLLEGE'S RADIOLOGY PROGRAM, CHILDREN'S ADVOCACY CENTER, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SHELTER, FOCUS HOUSE FOR JUVENILES, AND THE PARISH NURSING PROGRAM.
THE BAD DEBT EXPENSE WAS CALCULATED BY APPLYING THE COST-TO-CHARGE RATIO FROM THE MOST RECENT MEDICARE COST REPORT TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BAD DEBT EXPENSE FOR THE FISCAL YEAR.

THE ORGANIZATION EMPLOYS FINANCIAL COUNSELORS THAT WORK WITH ALL SELF-PAY PATIENTS. BASED ON REVIEW OF TAX RETURNS, BANK STATEMENTS, AND OTHER FINANCIAL DOCUMENTS PROVIDED BY THE PATIENT, AN ESTIMATE EQUAL TO 50% OF BAD DEBT PATIENTS WOULD QUALIFY FOR CHARITY CARE BUT FAILED TO PROVIDE THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF DOCUMENTATION.

THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT CONTAIN A FOOTNOTE THAT DESCRIBES BAD DEBT EXPENSE. BAD DEBT IS LISTED AS A DEDUCTION FROM REVENUE. THIS TREATMENT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE HFMA PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES BOARD STATEMENT NO. 15 AND WITH THE AICPA AUDIT AND ACCOUNTING GUIDE FOR HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS. THE COST TO CHARGE RATIO FORMULATED ON THE 2022 MEDICARE COST REPORT WAS USED TO CALULATE BAD DEBT AT COST. PATIENTS WHO MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BUT ARE UNKNOWN TO THE HOSPITAL ARE WRITTEN OFF TO BAD DEBT AND ARE NOT INCLUDED IN CHARITY CARE. HOWEVER, IF DURING THE COLLECTION PROCESS IT IS DETERMINED THAT THE PATIENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR CHARITY CARE THE DEBT IS RECLASSIFIED AS CHARITY CARE AND COLLECTION EFFORTS CEASE.

THE COST TO CHARGE RATIO FROM THE MEDICARE COST REPORT IS UTILIZED IN DETERMINING THE ORGANIZATION'S COMMUNITY BENEFIT.THE SHORTFALL REPORTED IN PART III, LINE 7 SHOULD BE TREATED AS COMMUNITY BENEFIT. BY PARTICIPATING IN MEDICARE AND ABSORBING RELATED SHORTFALLS, WE ARE PROVIDING HEALTHCARE SERVICES TO MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES WHO ARE A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF OUR COMMUNITY.

SELF PAY PATIENTS AND OTHER PATIENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP ARE GIVEN CHARITY APPLICATIONS AND ENCOURAGED TO COMPLETE AND RETURN THEM TO PATIENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. IN DISCUSSING PATIENTS CHARGES, FINANCIAL COUNSELORS WILL SUGGEST COMPLETION OF A CHARITY APPLICATION.

A COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT WAS CONDUCTED IN FY 2022. THIS STUDY IDENTIFIED SERVICES THE PUBLIC BELIEVES ARE NECESSARY IN THE COMMUNITY. THE TOP COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS IDENTIFIED WERE IMPROVE ACCESS TO BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES AND ADDRESS BARRIERS TO ACCESSING CARE.RCH PARTICIPATES IN THE ILLINOIS PLAN LOCAL ASSESSMENT NEEDS (IPLAN) WHICH ALSO INCLUDES THE OGLE COUNTY HEALTH DEPT AND MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. THE HEALTH STATUS OF THE COUNTY, AS EVIDENCED BY A MULTITUDE OF DATA AND RISK FACTORS, IS REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE AND PRIORITIES ARE DETERMINED TO HELP MEET IDENTIFIED NEEDS. THE GOAL IS TO WORK TOWARD ASSURING THAT NEEDS ARE BEING MET BY THE VARIOUS HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS.

IT IS HOSPITAL POLICY TO TREAT ALL PATIENTS WHO PRESENT FOR CARE WITHOUT REGARD FOR THEIR ABILITY TO PAY AND TO ASSIST THEM IN RESOLVING ANY FINANCIAL ISSUES INVOLVED WITH SERVICES PROVIDED. THE HOSPITAL'S CHARITY CARE POLICIES ARE POSTED AT ALL PATIENT ACCESS AREAS, IN INDIVIDUAL PATIENT CARE AREAS, AND ON THE HOSPITAL WEB SITE. UPON REGISTRATION, STAFF WILL EXPLAIN THE POLICY AND OFFER A CHARITY/FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE APPLICATION TO ALL SELF PAY PATIENTS. PATIENT FINANCIAL COUNSELORS WILL ALSO EXPLAIN THE HOSPITAL'S CHARITY POLICY WHEN DISCUSSING A BILL WITH A PATIENT. ALL BILLING STATEMENTS INCLUDE A STATEMENT ALERTING THE PATIENT OF HIS/HER RIGHT TO ACCESS HOSPITAL ASSISTANCE. ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED TO THE NON INSURED AND UNDER INSURED, INCLUDING ASSISTANCE IN APPLYING FOR MEDICAID IF APPROPRIATE. PATIENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO ACCESS THE HOSPITAL'S FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO INSURE THAT A TRUE NEED IS REFLECTED AS CHARITY RATHER THAN AN EVENTUAL BAD DEBT.

ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL IS A NON PROFIT 501(C)(3) CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL DEDICATED TO PROVIDING QUALITY HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES LOCALLY. THIS IS ACHIEVED BY PROVIDING INPATIENT MEDICAL SURGICAL, INTENSIVE CARE, AND SWING BED SERVICES, OUTPATIENT SURGICAL AND DIAGNOSTIC SERVICES, CARDIAC, PHYSICAL, AND RESPIRATORY THERAPIES, IMMEDIATE CARE, OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE, CLINICS, AND EMPLOYED PHYSICIANS. RCH SERVES WESTERN DEKALB, NORTHERN LEE, AND OGLE COUNTIES. THE HOSPITAL SERVES A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 18,000 IN THE CITY OF ROCHELLE AND SURROUNDING AREA. THE POPULATION IS DIVIDED ABOUT 25% UNDER AGE 20, 52% BETWEEN 20 AND 64, AND 23% 65 AND OVER. THE GROUP COVERED BY MEDICARE IS AT LEAST 50% OF THE HOSPITAL'S REVENUE. THE ROCHELLE AREA LAGS STATE WIDE NUMBERS IN GROWTH IN EMPLOYMENT AND PER CAPITA INCOME AND HAS A HIGHER PERCENT UNEMPLOYMENT. THE AREA IS DESIGNATED AS AN UNDERSERVED AREA BY CMS THRU HRSA.

ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL REACHES OUT TO THE COMMUNITY IN MANY WAYS TO PROMOTE WELLNESS AND IMPROVE THE OVERALL HEALTH:-FREE PUBLIC HEALTH SCREENINGS, COMMUNITY EDUCATION, HEALTH FAIRS, FIRST AID TENTS AT COMMUNITY EVENTS, FLU CLINICS, COORDINATED BLOOD DRIVES, VISITS TO SENIOR CITIZEN CENTERS, AND FIRST AID TRAINING.-EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO THE PUBLIC IN THE AREAS OF CARDIOLOGY, STROKE, DIABETES, NUTRITION, PARKINSONS, WOMEN'S HEALTH ISSUES, MEN'S HEALTH ISSUES, WELLNESS AND WEIGHT LOSS PROGRAMS.-FITNESS TRAINING CLASSES PROVIDED TO AREA SCHOOL EMPLOYEES AND HOSPITAL STAFF.-SPONSOR SUPPORT GROUPS FOR DIABETES, STROKE, PARKINSONS, ALANON, ALCOHOL ANONYMOUS, AND GROUP HOPE.-SUPPORT BY THE HOSPITAL AND STAFF FOR LOCAL HEALTH RELATED EVENTS- CANCER DRIVES, BLOOD DRIVES, UNITED WAY CAMPAIGN.-PARTICIPATE IN THE REGIONAL DISASTER PREPAREDNESS PLAN WITH OUR POD HOSPITAL AND REGIONAL HOSPITALS AND PROVIDE HAZMAT TRAINING LOCALLY.-PROVIDE SOME HOSPITAL SERVICES AT A FINANCIAL DISADVANTAGE BECAUSE THESE SERVICES ARE CRITICAL TO THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF THE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING EMERGENCY SERVICES, INTENSIVE CARE, SEVERAL CLINICS, IMMEDIATE CARE, AND OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH. CHAPLAIN SERVICES ARE ALSO PROVIDED TO PATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES.-PROVIDING STUDENT INTERNSHIP AND SHADOWING OPPORTUNITIES TO ENCOURAGE INCREASED INTEREST IN HEALTHCARE CAREERS.-MENTOR STUDENTS IN THE AREA OF PHARMACY, RADIOLOGY, HEALTH INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, NURSING, AND NURSING ASSISTANT AND PROVIDE ON SITE HOSPITAL TRAINING FOR THESE PROGRAMS.-DONATE UNUSED OR EXCESS SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT TO A NON PROFIT GLOBAL HEALTH NETWORK.-PROVIDE PATIENTS WITH MEDICAL RECORDS UPON REQUEST WITHOUT CHARGE.-EMPLOYEES SUPPORT LOCAL CHARITIES INCLUDING UNITED WAY, LOCAL FOOD AND CLOTHING DRIVES, CURE FOR CANCER, RELAY FOR LIFE.-THE HOSPITAL CAFETERIA PROVIDES A RELAXED DINING EXPERIENCE FOR MANY LOCAL RESIDENTS INCLUDING THOSE AT A NEARBY SENIOR LOW HOUSING UNIT. THESE MEALS ARE NORMALLY SERVED AT OR BELOW HOSPITAL COST.MANY HOSPITAL EMPLOYEES AND VOLUNTEERS (AUXILIARY AND FOUNDATION) ARE NOT ONLY PART OF THE HOSPITAL BUT INTEGRAL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. THEY HELP CEMENT THE RELATIONSHIP AMONG HEALTH CARE SERVICE PROVIDERS AND THE COMMUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, LINE 7, REPORTS FILED WITH STATES
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IL
DR. GADINI DELISCA'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES A GROSS-UP AMOUNT IN THE REIMBURSEMENT OF HIS SELF-PAID INSURANCE.
GREGORY A. OLSON RECEIVED THE FOLLOWING AMOUNTS: 457(F) PLAN CONTRIBUTION - $25,000 457(F) PLAN DISTRIBUTION - $75,000 LINE 4A PAYMENT - $313,166

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CITY OF ROCHELLE OGLE COUNTY ILLINOIS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE OFFICERS OF THE HOSPITAL AND UP TO TWO OTHER TRUSTEES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS AS NEEDED AND HAS THE POWER TO TRANSACT THE BUSINESS OF THE HOSPITAL DURING THE INTERIM BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE TRUSTEES, PROVIDED THAT NO ACTION CONFLICTS WITH THE EXPRESSED POLICIES OF THE BOARD AND FURTHER PROVIDED THAT ALL ACTIONS TAKEN ON MATTERS OF MAJOR SIGNIFICANCE ARE REFERRED TO THE BOARD FOR RATIFICATION AT THE NEXT REGULAR MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS WERE UPDATED IN THE CURRENT YEAR TO REMOVE VOTING RIGHTS OF THE MEMBERS. PREVIOUSLY, MEMBERS RESERVED THE RIGHT TO ELECT AND REMOVE TRUSTEES, APPROVE AMENDMENT OF THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR BYLAWS, APPROVE MERGER OR CONSOLIDATION OF THE HOSPITAL WITH ANOTHER ENTITY, APPROVE SALE, LEASE OR EXCHANGE OF ALL OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF THE HOSPITAL'S ASSETS AND APPROVE VOLUNTARY DISSOLUTION OF THE HOSPITAL. MEMBERS STILL RETAIN THE RIGHT TO ATTEND THE MEETINGS AND DISCUSS THESE ITEMS, BUT ULTIMATE AUTHORITY NOW LIES SOLELY WITH THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS WERE ALSO UPDATED IN THE CURRENT YEAR TO CHANGE THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF TRUSTEES. PREVIOUSLY, EXACTLY 12 TRUSTEES WERE REQUIRED. THE BYLAWS NOW REQUIRED A MINIMUM OF 12 TRUSTEES AND A MAXIMUM OF 14 TRUSTEES. TRUSTEES ARE NO LONGER REQUIRED TO BE MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FROM AND AFTER MAY 1, 1965, ANY PERSON WHO HAS GIVEN $25 OR MORE IN CASH OR PROPERTY CAN BECOME, UPON REQUEST, A MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION FOR ONE YEAR. ANY PERSON WHO HAS GIVEN $1,000 OR MORE IN CASH OR PROPERTY CAN BECOME, UPON REQUEST, A MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION FOR LIFE, OR IN THE CASE OF A LEGAL ENTITY, FOR THE DURATION OF ITS EXISTENCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HOSPITAL'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES INCLUDES THE CURRENT CHIEF OF THE MEDICAL STAFF, THE CURRENT CHIEF OF STAFF ELECT, AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL AUXILIARY. THE CHIEF OF THE MEDICAL STAFF AND THE CHIEF OF STAFF ELECT ARE ELECTED BY THE HOSPITAL'S MEDICAL STAFF. THE PRESIDENT OF THE ROCHELLE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL AUXILIARY IS ELECTED BY THE AUXILIARY'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE REMAINING TRUSTEES ARE ELECTED BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE GOVERNING BODY (BOARD OF TRUSTEES) AND THE GOVERANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING. THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO, CFO, AND OTHER MEMBERS OF THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT ALSO REVIEWED A COPY OF THE RETURN. IF CHANGES ARE NECESSARY, THEY ARE REPORTED TO THE RETURN PREPARER AND INCORPORATED INTO THE FINAL RETURN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE INVESTIGATED BY APPOINTED MEMBERS OF THE GOVERANCE COMMITTEE ON AN ONGOING BASIS. IF IT IS DETERMINED THAT AN INDIVIDUAL FAILED TO DISCLOSE AN ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, IT SHALL INFORM THE INDIVIDUAL OF SUCH A BELIEF AND AFFORD HIM AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLAIN. AFTER SAID EXPLANATION, THE BOARD SHALL TAKE APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION AS DEEMED NECESSARY. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD ANNUALLY AND UPDATED AS NEEDED. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND ADMINISTRATION TEAM SIGN CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURES ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE, ADMINISTRATOR AND KEY EMPLOYEE (MANAGEMENT) COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY THE USE OF COMPARABLE DATA, INCLUDING INDEPENDENT SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY THE ILLINOIS HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION AND ILLINOIS CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL NETWORK. THIS INFORMATION IS COLLECTED FROM LIKE-SIZE ORGANIZATIONS. ADDITIONALLY, COMPARABLE INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED FROM AN INDEPENDENT HEALTHCARE CONSULTING FIRM WHICH INCLUDED SALARY RANGES, MEDIAN AND QUARTERLY PERCENTILE RANK OF COMPARABLE HOSPITALS. THIS INFORMATION IS REVIEWED BY THE HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGER, CHIEF EXECUTIVE AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE PROCESS WAS LAST COMPLETED IN FISCAL YEAR 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST IN WRITING TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE.

MEDICAL SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 4,561,511. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 12,306. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 4,573,817. PATIENT SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 72,775.
